intro: Bulbostylis togoensis, commonly known as Togo's bulbostylis, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Native to West Africa, particularly Togo, this plant thrives in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its native range.
